contents:
It seems partially true, at least in Stockholm Region. Unbelievable. 

The following information can be found on https://www.worldometers.info/coronavirus/
167 new cases in Sweden, [source] which announced that testing for Covid-19 will cease unless you are hospitalized or belong to one of the risk groups. Even if you report corona-like symptoms [source]


The original source: https://www.dn.se/sthlm/farre-kommer-att-provtas-for-coronaviruset-i-stockholm/

Google translate reads that 
Anyone who suspects that he or she has been infected by the corona virus in the Stockholm region will no longer be tested. Only those who are already in hospital or belong to a risk group will be sampled.

On Wednesday, the Stockholm Region changed its way of dealing with new suspected cases of the new corona virus. The sampling of new suspected cases will be concentrated on those already in hospital. Others, who are not in a risk group, will not be tried.


Further search on https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_coronavirus_pandemic_in_Sweden reveals that
After the announcement of the Public Health Agency of Sweden to protect the elderly and the frail, Stockholm Region decided to change their strategy for testing for COVID-19 to mainly focus on the very ill and not just persons who had visited risk areas.
"Fyra akutsjukhus i stabsläge på grund av coronasmittan". DN.SE (in Swedish). 11 March 2020. Retrieved 11 March 2020.


This is also confirmed in https://www.thelocal.se/20200312/why-were-slightly-changing-how-the-local-covers-the-coronavirus-crisis
From today, Stockholm will no longer be testing all suspected cases of the coronavirus. Up until now their focus was on testing each and every one who returned from a high-risk area with symptoms, and then tracing all their contacts to stop the virus from spreading.

Now that we have had the first signs of so-called community infection, when the virus is starting to spread in Sweden (this is not the case for all of Sweden, only the Västra Götaland and Stockholm regions), health authorities believe this is no longer the best approach.

Instead, Stockholm will focus on protecting the elderly and people in hospital with underlying health conditions, so the testing will mainly be limited to those at-risk groups from now on.
